summary: BuildRequest is promotion-only with an explicit constraint of no code changes. The diff introduces multiple code and documentation changes, adds backend build-management logic, and updates/notes many frontend/UI behaviors. It does not provide confirmation that production now serves Draft Version 140 nor a live URL/environment identifier proving the promotion completed.

missing_requirements.requirement: Promote the currently deployed draft build (Draft Version 140) to the live production deployment so end users receive the latest version.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows added documentation and backend helper methods, but no evidence of an actual production promotion having been executed or production being updated to serve version 140.

missing_requirements.requirement: Live/production environment serves the same app version as Draft Version 140.
missing_requirements.reason: No diff evidence demonstrates that production is now serving v140; the status doc explicitly says promotion is pending and production version is 'Awaiting promotion of v140'.

missing_requirements.requirement: Provide a live URL (or environment identifier) confirming the production deployment completed successfully.
missing_requirements.reason: The deployment status doc leaves the live URL as 'To be provided after promotion' and does not include an environment identifier confirming completion.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend 'Build Deployment Management' system added/modified (build version types/state, admin-only promoteBuildToProduction, queries for production/draft version, build listing, initialization of draft v140).
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest explicitly states no code changes are requested; only a deployment/promotion is requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Added deployment process documentation and a release record document with a long list of product features and verification checklist.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested; BuildRequest asks to promote an already-deployed draft to production and provide confirmation, not to add new documentation or feature inventories.

hallucinated_features.description: Frontend/UI behavior changes described across many files (splash slideshow changes, styling tokens, new components/animations, dependency changes, route/page behavior updates).
hallucinated_features.reason: Non-goal explicitly forbids implementing new features or UI changes; diff summary indicates many such changes were made.

hallucinated_features.description: Project metadata/state update describing broader system features and backend wiring.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested as part of a promotion-only request; also conflicts with 'no code changes' constraint if it reflects additional implementation work.
